S.chief_complaint: Right ankle pain and swelling following a fall.

history_of_present_illness.injury_details: Patient tripped over a curb while jogging 2 hours ago. Reports an 'inversion' injury (rolled ankle inward).
history_of_present_illness.pain_details: Sharp, localized pain over the outer ankle. Patient is unable to bear full weight.

S.past_medical_history: Denies previous ankle fractures or surgeries.

O.physical_exam: Significant edema and ecchymosis over the lateral malleolus. Tenderness present at the anterior talofibular ligament (ATFL). No bony tenderness over the base of the 5th metatarsal.
O.diagnostic_results: X-ray of the right ankle: Pending.

A.preliminary_assessment: Presentation is highly suggestive of a Grade II lateral ankle sprain. While the Ottawa Ankle Rules are borderline due to weight-bearing difficulty, the lack of midfoot bone tenderness makes a fracture less likely but still requires exclusion.
A.ruling_out: Lateral malleolus fracture, syndesmotic (high ankle) sprain.

recommendations: RICE protocol: Rest, Ice (20 mins on/off), Compression with ACE wrap, Elevation.
Pharmacological: Ibuprofen 400mg every 6 hours as needed for pain and inflammation.
Non-weight bearing until X-ray results are confirmed.
P.education: Instructed patient on the proper use of crutches and to watch for signs of neurovascular compromise (numbness or blue toes).
